review: Dr Basavaraj is clearly very experienced and is extremely confident of the treatment that he gives. Also, his ability to understand critical problems easily. We went to him a few years back after my kid had undergone treatment from many expert pediatricians, he was able to figure out the problem in a single sitting.

Had an appointment for 5pm, doctor arrived at 7pm. Had to wait 2 whole hours with 2 sick children. I have no problem with the doctor & his treatment but his reception mustn't give out appointments for times he's not in office and must give realistic time as to when he will return instead of saying 'he's on his way for 2 whole hours'
Good to hear all the problems and also he suggested/refereed to other doctors to who are specific to that treatment.

tags: Wait time,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review: My wife had cesarean and got discharged on 17-01-2018, and the has told us to come on 19th for vaccination and reports of baby, took appointment on 19th evening but with great difficulty we went to the hospital but we were asked to wait and there was no vaccination just generally he checked and asked us to go, if this was the procedure we would have not went to him, he does not discuss anything in detail, we have decided not to consult him any more.
